column4: I just installed ubuntu, it used the nv driver for xorg out of the box, but does it come with the nvidia? I noticed the nvidia modules exist but when I change nv in xorg.conf to nvidia x wont start..ideas?
out of curiousity what kernel are you running?
isn't THC a drug? or like a chemical in marijuna
lemme check mustard5
hmmm well that blows my theory away :)  I've seen quite few with your issue on K7 kernel and I thought that might be the prolbem.
so changing nv to nvidia in xorg.conf is all i should have to do?
Should I upgrade my kernel?
no
unless you really want to, but it wont fix this problem i dont think
hmm I see
Wow, sorry for wasting your time, I just needed to install nvidia-glx
I'll just check the forum where I was reading about your issue..maybe something has changed
oh..ok..hehe I would have normally said that myself, but it hasnt worked for some people lately :)
hmm...mustard5, What should I add to xorg.conf to get a 85hz refresh rate
Im trying to save my eyes here ;)
[Chameleon] : Do I need to install randr seprately?
if so, whats its package name?
k
[Chameleon] : I'm seeing libxrandr2 but not the actual package
[Chameleon] : thanks
soz..someone at the door. :)   I wouldn't have know anyway
